name: Corn Tortillas Using Homemade Masa Dough
description: We're using fresh masa dough to make a delicious batch of homemade corn tortillas!  We also added some masa harina to the dough to make it easier to work with.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup masa harina (plus more if necessary)

recipeInstructions.text: First gauge how 'wet' your masa dough is.  If it sticks to your hands you'll need to add some masa harina to dry it out.  I added 1/4 cup masa harina to 2 cups of masa dough.  Combine well using your hands.
recipeInstructions.name: First gauge how 'wet' your masa dough is.  If it sticks to your hands you'll need to add some masa harina to dry it out.  I added 1/4 cup masa harina to 2 cups of masa dough.  Combine well using your hands.

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the dough into golfball sized rounds, this will make the tortillas approximately 4 inches across.
recipeInstructions.name: Separate the dough into golfball sized rounds, this will make the tortillas approximately 4 inches across.

recipeInstructions.text: Flatten the dough balls using a tortilla press or a flat bottomed casserole dish.  Be sure to line each side of the dough ball with plastic or ziploc pieces.  The tortillas should peel off the ziploc easily; if not then you might need to add some masa harina to the dough.
recipeInstructions.name: Flatten the dough balls using a tortilla press or a flat bottomed casserole dish.  Be sure to line each side of the dough ball with plastic or ziploc pieces.  The tortillas should peel off the ziploc easily; if not then you might need to add some masa harina to the dough.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet or comal to medium heat.  Add a tortilla and flip after 10 seconds. Then cook each side for 1-2 minutes or until light brown spots are forming.  Alternatively, you can skip the quick flip and just cook each side for 1-2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a skillet or comal to medium heat.  Add a tortilla and flip after 10 seconds. Then cook each side for 1-2 minutes or until light brown spots are forming.  Alternatively, you can skip the quick flip and just cook each side for 1-2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, keeping them warm in a tortilla warmer or kitchen towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, keeping them warm in a tortilla warmer or kitchen towel.
